text: And the sons of Israel set out and they encamped in the Aravah of Moab on the other side of the Jordan from Jericho.
And Balak, son of Tsipor, saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
And Moab was troubled due to the presence of the great people, for they were many. So Moab loathed the presence of the sons of Israel.

And Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this assembly will lick up everything round about as the ox licks up the green plants of the field.
And Balak son of Tsipor, king of Moab at that time,

sent messengers to Balaam, son of Beor, in Pethor, which is by the river, in the land of the sons of his people, to call him, saying, 
“Behold, a people has come forth from Egypt, and behold, covered, there is no ground, and they have settled near me.”

And now go and curse for me this people, for they are too mighty for me; perhaps I will prevail and smite them and drive them out from the land, for I know that whomever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.
And the elders of of Moab and the elders of Midian—with divination in hand—set out. And they came to Balaam and they spoke to him and the saying of Balak.
